Class dominoes.Table 

java.lang.Object
   |
   +----dominoes.Table
public class Table
extends Object
This class represents the game layout and the bones that have been played. You can ask the layout what bones are on the ends to check and see if a valid play is possible.

Table()

layout()
Return the layout of the board, for user interface purposes
left()
Get the number of dots which is the left most on the table.
play(Play)
Make a play on the table.
right()
Get the number of dots which is the right most on the table.

Table 
  public Table()

play 
  public void play(Play p) throws InvalidPlayException
Make a play on the table.
Parameters:
p - the play to make on the table
Throws: InvalidPlayException
thrown when the play cannot be made on the table.
left 
  public int left()
Get the number of dots which is the left most on the table.
Returns:
the number on the left most end of the played bones
right 
  public int right()
Get the number of dots which is the right most on the table.
Returns:
the number on the right most end of the played bones
layout 
  public Bone[] layout()
Return the layout of the board, for user interface purposes
Returns:
an array which is the ordering that the bones lay on the table.
